result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayanna Renetta Gordon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon appeared by video.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Shayanna Renetta Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon in court.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Shayanna Renetta Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz for Mallory Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Lauren Marowsky - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State V Lee Hearing. Defense counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing to Br 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. State requests a State v. Lee Hearing. Court orders matter adjourned in Branch 29.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Shayanna Renetta Gordon
Current: 3730 W Capitol Dr., Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 05-16-2022)
Prior: 7331 West Silver Spring Drive #4, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court orders that the Defendant follows all DMCPS orders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LMT, LJT, CLG.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.

Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon in court with Student Intern Simon Earle under the supervision of attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shayanna Renetta Gordon not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@2:30p
